Reviews.Title: “ONE NIGHT STAY”
Reviews.Author: ScottieCalgary
Reviews.Content: This was reasonably priced for the San Diego area at $49.95 for a double. The rooms are small, however they are comfortable and clean, complete with microwave and fridge. There was a continental breakfast included which is all I need to get me going in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap- You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: nerual
Reviews.Content: This place is cheap and you get what you pay for...Bare bones, small room. Good if you need a place to crash, but don't expect much more. Pros- Clean Free WiFi Free parking Microwave Mini fridge Location Cons- Small rooms Slow Wifi Sligtly ghetto feel

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: UKX
Reviews.Content: Was good for the price, and getting to places. Room was quite small, and the woman on reception was a little bit moody! Good for getting to Seaworld, Fashion Valley etc :)

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay just shame about the aftercare”
Reviews.Author: GemsG
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked at America's Best Value Inn in August as our first stop on a bit of a tour of California. We weren't expecting much just somewhere to lay our weary heads after a long flight from the UK, what we did find as we drove up and down Mission Bay Drive is America's Best Value Inn was no longer in existence and now with no warning had turned into a Red Roof Inn. it appeared that they had our booking which was great only to find when I got home that not only they but the company we had booked through had taken payment for the rooms. Not great but thought it could be easily sorted... I've tried contacting them several times but I'm still not getting an answer and I'm getting a bit frustrated. The rooms themselves were average, ok bed, air con not too noisy and breakfast was served in one of the hotel's rooms and was of average quality. If you're not expecting much the Red Roof Inn is a good place to stay, if you want customer service then please don't go here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: brownie06
Reviews.Content: For the money spent, it served the purpose of having a place to sleep! The room was small, but clean. It was easy to get to places such as Old town, the sea world and Coronado Island from this hotel. Dont even bother with the breakfast. It was a very sad excuse for it!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money and location”
Reviews.Author: Teach4Jan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel in a room with a queen-size bed for 2 nights. The room was very small for 2 people but did have a refrig, microwave, and coffee pot in it. The location was convenient to drive everywhere you would want to go. Can't walk anywhere except to a few restaurants. You do need a car. It was a short drive to Pacific Beach and Seaworld. The breakfast was from 7 - 10 and was very basic. This motel is good if you just want to sleep and get out quick in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, basic comforts but not bad”
Reviews.Author: JackCrowley
Reviews.Content: I was looking last minute for an inexpensive single room for a couple of nights in San Diego and found this advertised as Red Roof Inns latest hotel. The price was right and the online reviews weren't scary. I booked a queen sized bed n/s on their website to get the best rate. The location was easy to find and the check in staff were quick and friendly. The room was pretty small but comfortable for one person. The decor was very typical of this class hotel, read serviceable but well worn. It was quiet and I slept well. Breakfast was basic but enjoyable. WiFi in the room worked perfectly. Some minor inconveniences like a burnt and stained coffee pot or a tricky sink faucet would not stop me from staying there again or recommending this hotel to someone looking for basic economy accommodations in San Diego for a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Graham D
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Small room, small pool. Poor breakfast. Helpful Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Clean. Don't expect any surprises”
Reviews.Author: aphex3k
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but clean. Bath is clean as well. If this is what you want to find, feel free to stay here. Rooms are ok if you are only looking for a place to sleep and will be somewhere else the rest of the day. The motel is situated close to the highway so that you constantly hear street noise during the night. WiFi is free and if broke, try the open AP from the car trader next door. Service is friendly, breakfast is crap.

Reviews.Title: “good value for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: anemonefish
Reviews.Content: The AMVI delivers what it promises. Given the low rates, that will be plenty for those with price point as the top consideration. Free WiFi and good TV. We requested a quiet top floor room when booking online and they honored that request. Amenities consist of soap. The tiny room had a small microwave and fridge, and a coffee maker is provided. It's the 3-floor aging econobox style with functioning window opening onto exterior walkway. Linens were adequate. Bed firm and comfortable. Room showed wear, but was clean. Heat/AC unit under the window. Rooms are non-smoking, but ash trays are provided along the walkway, so it's not a truly non-smoking venue. Elevator. Location is commercial grotty, convenient to freeways and attractions. Parking relatively secure. Overall, an OK place to stay on the cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesRohan
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked into the office to check in we knew we had stumbled upon a gem. The hotel manager greeted us with a huge smile and let us know off the bat that our wish was his command. He gave us directions to Sea World (one or two exits away) and Downtown San Diego/Gaslamp Quarters (about a 5 min. drive) as well as tips on the exact location of the FREE parking areas throughout the city. He also told us not to worry about finding a taxi because he would do that for us. When we got up to our room we were both pleased to find a very clean and fresh smelling room with all the amenities we had hoped for (Wi-Fi, Cable TV w/ HBO, a large comfortable bed, A/C, and a COFFEE MAKER with complimentary coffee). There were also plenty of towels and toiletries (A huge issue for my girlfriend). The manager called us a taxi and even negotiated a fixed rate for us. The hotel was very quiet and we had a great night sleep after exploring Downtown. I would strongly reccomend America's Best Value Inn to anyone looking for a Great Place for a Great Price!

Reviews.Title: “Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Almolm
Reviews.Content: This place was a very nice place to stay. It was less than 2 miles from Pacific beach in San Diego California. The front desk ladies were extremely helpful and courteous to me and my uncle. The manager was extremely helpful with computer issues that I had in regards to the internet at no additional charge. I would like to recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a nice play to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Michelle at this motel was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: stewWash
Reviews.Content: This motel was small and out of the way if you're walking, but the people at the desk were great at telling you how to get to places and even got me bus routes, times, and trolleys so I could travel to near the border. They were also good at letting you use a computer and helping with airline check-in. Michelle in particular was very helpful and a delightful person. The rooms were very clean for an older place and I would be willing to stay again. Having breakfast was a nice amenity too. Weather could have been nicer but they had no control over that!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but got everything you need, lovely place”
Reviews.Author: SP_516
Reviews.Content: The room is a bit small, but quite equiped with a refrige, a microwave, a TV and a bath tub. It is very clean and hotel staff are very friendly and eager to help. It's quite near of the beach and Sea World, so if you are looking for a pleasure holiday on the beach, it's the best place to stay. Would definitely come again next time.~

Reviews.Title: “Great motel-great price”
Reviews.Author: Sparrowrun
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located motel, near Interstate 5 without the interstate noise. Rooms are small along with the pool, but very clean, with microwave, fridge, coffee maker, hair dryer. Continental breakfast included but I only had coffee. Pool large enough for the kids and water exercising.Convenience store next door along with some eateries.Convenient to Mission Bay Park and Sea World, free parking. Nice staff. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: beachguy950
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay here at the Inn at Mission Bay. Everyone was very friendly. My room was quiet and clean. The price was the cheapest around and the location was great! Lots of fun things to do right around the area!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with the Bums”
Reviews.Author: Reisemama
Reviews.Content: Nothing against the homeless, but as a matter of hygiene, I would rather not have breakfast with my children in a breakfast room where people in filthy clothes predominate. I am glad the homeless have places like this to resort to, they live a tough life, and but for the grace of God, there go I. However, if this inn rents on a weekly basis, it should not advertise as a family/vacation inn. I was really worried about my children, mainly about them catching diseases, such as Hepatitis.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated???”
Reviews.Author: 96786_baby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 2/3-2/6/09 in room 323. I booked this room because of the low price, free parking, in room amenities like free high speed internet, microwave & refrigerator, laundry facility, and the fact that it is stated on their website ([-]) that the rooms are "newly renovated". Well, I don't know about the other rooms but ours didn't seem newly renovated (see the pictures) BUT, it was clean (except the carpet...it needed to be deep cleaned or changed) and we only needed a place to sleep as we would be out all day at Sea World & San Diego Zoo. I didn't mind that it didn't look at all renovated but I just feel like I was tricked to thinking so. I hate walking around in the hotel room with my slippers on so I walked barefoot and then washed it before I jump in bed or before I put on my shoes. So, besides the carpet being a little dirty, everything else was fine. The biggest pro for us was the easy & short access to the freeway/highway, very short drive to Sea World (5-7min.), drive to San Diego Zoo was about 10-15min. (of course on depending on traffic), and close to grocery stores & restaurants (located on Garnet St., Balboa & Grand Ave.). Because we were there at a not so peak time, there were very few guests so it was pretty quiet (which we love), not crowded at the continental breakfast (which was pretty decent & satisfied our morning to last till lunch), & LOTS of parking. I did a lot of research before booking this hotel and a few other hotels I had in mind were reviewed by other travelers saying that the parking was too tight & narrow and we were renting a mini-van so I didn't want to take a chance and that was the other reason I booked Inn at Mission Bay. The con about this hotel (besides the room & carpet), was the noise from people next door closing their doors or people walking on balcony hallway (if you're on the 2nd or 3rd floors). The flooring was wood so you could hear the footsteps. The other thing was the room door has a small gap at the bottom so at night there would be light shining thru and the gap is probably the reason for the noise. I know I mention below that I would not recommend this hotel to a friend but that's only because I know how my friends are but, if they are on a budget and don't mind the small room, outside noise, and somewhat dirty carpet, this place is just fine. Why get a fancy, shmancy room and end up paying up the whazoo for something you're only using to shower & sleep?!? Well, if you can afford it, by all means but if you're on a budget, this place is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very cheap”
Reviews.Author: Buckaroo_Infinity
Reviews.Content: Don't be too put off by the reviews - if you want somewhere ultra cheap and convenient then the hotel is fine. I wouldn't stay here with a family because the rooms are incredibly small. I also wouldn't stay here for more than 1 or 2 nights but it's clean and safe. There are a few restaurants in the area, but I personally took the bus to the beach. The bus stop is 1 minutes walk away and the ride takes no more than 10 minutes. Just get out when you can see the ocean!

Reviews.Title: “Eh...”
Reviews.Author: missourigirl127
Reviews.Content: I had read some reviews about this place, and wouldn't have stayed here had I not been traveling with a friend that is super stingy and never wants to pay money for a decent hotel room. This place was certainly not bad - but it had some problems. While they advertise a 'free' breakfast...it was not anything I was interested in eating. They had a few sugary cereals, white toast and some pastry items. I opted to go out to eat and spend money on proper food. They advertised a pool......either it wasn't up and running or they didn't have one. The rooms were clean and well-kept, but the mattresses both had rust stains on the sides, and an article I read a few months later said that stains on mattresses can be indicative of bed bugs. Ew! Their vending machines weren't stocked, so we opted to walk next door in the scary nighttime to the 7-11. The stay was comfortable....but if I head to San Diego again...I'll absolutely stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: itravel6
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last month on the third floor. I think it was room 318. The hotel smelled very badly. But worst of all, there were bugs in the bathroom and my sister and I were bitten by bed bugs. I even brought one home. We thought it was a great deal to find a hotel for $100 in San Diego. It wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room BUT the rest bad!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sassie123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean on the outside and our room was also clean BUT it was SMALL!!!! There was barely room to walk between the bed and TV stand, then when you came out of the bathroom in the middle of the night you walked right into the nightstand that was next to the bed. They advertise a low rate in the "room saver" and "travel coupon books" as well as on AAA BUT when you call for it in the morning they have no rooms available. We ended up paying much more than the $69 special. The topper to the stay was getting up to go to the "deluxe" continental breakfast. We walk into a room that was converted for the use of "breakfast" (three tables with room for 2 people on each) and all were full. There was a "maintenance" man who was putting fresh pastries out and at first he was using tongs and then moved to using his UNGLOVED hands to put the UNWRAPPED food on the trays. We opted not to have these items and put together a bowl of microwaved oatmeal. Got it in the microwave and a ton of people (or should I say pigs) came in and that was it for us. We were unable to remove our food from the microwave because the rude people would not let us "in front of them" and there were a few who stood behind us eating their food with their mouths wide open. A very disgusting thing and we walked out. When we checked out the maintenance man was reported to the front desk and all the girl said was "well I guess I can tell the manager". If you opt to stay here I wish you luck and a better stay than what we had!! OHHHH and the bed was hard as a rock.....not a good nights sleep there

Reviews.Title: “Small, but nice”
Reviews.Author: StPtCooks
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Mission Bay is in a good location, especially if you want to be close to Mission Beach and SeaWorld without hustle and bustle 24-hrs./day. The rooms are on the small side but complete with a refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker, desk, and table with two chairs. They are clean and the housekeeping staff is quick to make up your room when requested, or they will not disturb you if desired. The front desk staff at this hotel is extremely friendly - they quickly offer advice on where to eat and shop and what to do, and then print off directions for you. Everyone was very helpful and pleasant! The pool is on the small side as well, but it is clean and fun. The continental breakfast offers a fine variety of cereals, pastries, toast, fresh fruit, juices, teas and coffee. We stayed 5 nights at this hotel, and though the breakfast choices were the same all 5 mornings, no one minded a bit. (but we would have liked to see more bananas). We did hear some noise on the weekend nights, as other guests were returning to the hotel late - but we put towels by the door and that seemed to help a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Dalrose
Reviews.Content: Just came back from staying at his hotel. Was kind of worried based on reviews but everything else was too expensive or sold out. The place was clean, and nice. The front desk people were nice and helpful. There was also plenty of parking. It was your average motel, nothing fancy. It had 2 queen beds, tv with cable, air cond, and microwave and a mini fridge which came in handy when traveling with kids, The pool was small but heated . There is also a laundry room if you needed. The breakfast was not that great but just had the basics: apple and orange juice, pastries, oatmeal, and 2 kinds of cereals. Like I said, nothing fancy but we really were not hanging out at the hotel, just shower and sleep. Very close to the beach and Sea World. Will definitely stay there again. Paid $90. AAA discount. When I called them directly they quoted me a higher price but when I did it through their website they gave me lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buy”
Reviews.Author: phil˙
Reviews.Content: It's really the Inn at Mission Bay Drive in automobile row with not even a glimpse of the Bay. But the rooms are clean and quiet. Though compact--the queen bed fills the room--still there's a color TV, a microwave, a coffee maker, and a refrigerator. And a desk to put the laptop on while one makes use of the free Wi-Fi (no nearby electric plug, though). Check-in time is 3:00, but they let us check in at 12:00 and had our Sea World and Zoo tickets ready at the desk saving us waits in line. A Rubio's is just across the street, and Sea World is seven minutes by car. Its cost makes it a best buy and we got a 10% AARP discount off that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: getoutf4fun
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great location its 2 mile to beach and easy on and off of the I-5 Freeway if you are going to Sea World which is about 3.4 Miles and if you are concered about the free way noise then it far from so you shouldn't be bother by noise. Great place to eat if you are from out of state then you should try In and Out Burger and lots fo restaraunts in Pacific Beach Area.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: KathIllinois
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for 3 nights but left after the first night. The room was so filthy that we kept our shoes on. The hotel was dirty inside and out. The room was so small we had to stack our luggage on the table, there wasn't even a closet. The walls were paper thin, we were up most of the night by the noise. This was the worst hotel I have ever been too.

Reviews.Title: “Complete RIP OFF!!! Disgusting small room, bad area..I was charged $179.00”
Reviews.Author: shayman2
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this place to enjoy a couple of days in San Diego.The pictures online looked fine so I called and Kumar quoted me $179.00 a night We were going to stay 2 nights. This place was no $179.00 a night Hotel!!!! When we arrived the Hotel is on a busy street with Bums hanging around the room was very small and had a strong musty odor.. The room wasn't to dirty but the odor was horrible. The pool is a joke a tiny little pool tucked in a corner of the parking lot barley large enough for little kids to play in no lounge chairs or anything.We were supposed to stay 2 nights but there is no way in HELL I was going to stay another night in this Place.The night we stayed was terrible by I could not sleep from the smell and by morning I had a sore throat from breathing the musty are all night.Needless to say the first thing I did when I woke up was get on the phone to find any place else to stay, because I honestly did not want to spend another minute at the Inn at Mission Bay..We arrived in July during the busy season and it is hard to find a room last minute and these guys took advantage and ripped me off charging $179.00 plus tax a total of $197.00 for a room that should get maybe $59.00 at the most... I would STAY AWAY FROM INN AT MISSION BAY.. your much better off staying at the Motel 6 on Hotel circle way nicer rooms and pool for way less than these guys charge..

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Central Location”
Reviews.Author: EstherAlaska
Reviews.Content: The staff members are great as demonstrated by the offer of an early check in after our all night flight, opening the breakfast buffet a bit early when we were peeking in the window, and suggesting an inexpensive airport shuttle for our departure. The housekeeping staff checked with us twice to make sure we had everything we needed. The property is average, meeting expectations as related to the discounted price. The pool is very tiny -- looks much larger on the hotel website. The rooms are simple, clean and the shower pressure and hot water could be counted on. Also, each room included a microwave, small coffee pot with coffee provided, small fridge that worked well, and plenty of towels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Buy for the Money in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: luckymonster
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews in TripAdvisor, we were not sure what to expect, but for less than $60 a night including tax, we were willing to take a chance. We asked for a top floor room with the rooms on the sides of us not occupied if the motel was not busy. We checked in and were given precisely what we asked for, a room at the back end of the motel on the top floor. There was an elevator (something not mentioned in the AAA Book) which was a bonus for a third floor room. The room was EXACTLY as pictured in the website and in their ads. It was a bit small but extremely clean and the amenities were all there, fridge, micro, coffeemaker, hairdryer, etc. The bathroom was bigger than normal and very clean. Mattress was new and very comfortable. The motel was not too busy and it was a comfortable place to stay, especially for travelers who wish to visit Sea World, as The Inn is less than 3 miles from Sea World. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the price ~ Don't expect the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: cyncharoo
Reviews.Content: I was pretty unsure about staying at this place considering the less than stellar reviews found here. Since this was a last minute decision to visit family and friends in San Diego, I decided to just try it because it was the best price out there. The other reason I decided to give this hotel a chance was because the last review left here was from several months ago and I was optimistic things had changed for the better. I can say we were pleasantly surprised :) I booked my stay at this hotel through their official website and it was very easy to do. The website said the hotel was newly renovated and I can tell you that the website photos of the room decor is accurate. There isn't a seperate closet space but there is an area to hang your clothes off to the corner if you choose not to use the drawers. We had 2 queen beds and that suited us fine. We took a peek at the mattresses and you could tell they were worn but there was a mattress pad topper to try and revive the "cushiness". It wasn't the most comfortable bed I ever slept in, but I didn't toss & turn like I have at some other hotels either. We checked in that day at 3pm and I was helped by a young woman who was friendly and we just unloaded our stuff and headed out again. We came back later that evening and found that parking spaces had filled up quickly. We found a spot right near our room but I assume people that checked in very late might of had issues with that. The room seemed stuffy when we got back but once the AC kicked in, we were quite comfortable. When making my online reservation, I requested a ground floor room because my brother has knee problems and has trouble navigating stairs and that is exactly what we were given. I didn't see anything on their website mentioning an elevator but we later found there was one. We tested it out just for this review and it worked fine. The rooms are small but they are clean. The bathroom was simple and clean and the shower had great water pressure. The only bad notes I can make about this hotel is that there was an old stain on the carpet in front of the fridge. It looked as if someone had spilled their drink. The other negative note is the parking situation that I already mentioned. I know they had a pool but we didn't have time for that. The next morning we checked out early because we were heading to the Kobey's Swap meet before we headed back home. We grabbed some of the free breakfast before we checked out. The breakfast room is on the 2nd floor and it's a very small area with just a few tables. The beverage items I remember are coffee, milk, orange and apple juice. I believe I saw tea packets as well. The food items were small muffins, danishes, a couple of cereal choices and apples. (I don't recall if there was other fruit as well and I know there was a toaster but I can't remember what types of bread were offerd.) After we grabbed a handful of stuff, my family headed to the car while I went to check-out. This time it was a different young woman at the front desk and I found her to be friendly as well. Checking out was quick and easy. The hotel is located on a fairly busy street but I never had any problems getting around. It has easy access to the freeway so as soon as you are out the parking lot, you're on your way to your next destination. Even though it is close to the freeway, we didn't have any problems with the noise. I only heard the person above our room a couple of times and it was only loud footsteps, not voices. So... why did I rate this hotel just 3 stars? Well... because 4 stars is ABOVE average and you shouldn't expect that from this hotel. I'd say it's an average hotel where you get what you pay for. This place suited our needs just fine and if I had to make another last minute trip to San Diego again, I wouldn't have any problems staying here again. I saw lots of families stay at this hotel and I assume they also found it was the best place to stay if on a budget :)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Made reservations for two nights when they had us down for only one. Sheets in the room were stained and stained carpet. Afraid to sleep on the bed. Would have moved hotels but was not able to find anything else open. Horrible experience and rude front desk staff. Language barrier - extreme difficulty undestanding the front desk clerk. Wish I had thought to take photos to post.

Reviews.Title: “They Will Charge You Even if you Cancel Your Reservation!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler95670
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for two rooms at this hotel and they only gave me one confirmation number for my two rooms. Within 24 hours I decided to cancel my reservations so I gave them my confirmation number and informed them to cancel both of my rooms. The person I spoke with told me they only reserved me one room, not the two I requested, and he would cancel that room without a charge since it was within 24hrs. He gave me my cancellation number so I thought everything was taken care of. Boy was I wrong!! The hotel ended up charging me for the other room three weeks later! I called and was informed the manager was not in and he would call me to handle the matter. He never called so a few hours later I called and had to deal with the rudest human being I have ever had to deal with. He told me that even though they show my cancellation on the computer unless I provide the # to them on the phone it is their policy to keep the charge but he was going to do me a favor and undo the charges but not any of my bank fees. I told him I wanted to speak to the manager and he told me if I talk to them the deal goes out the window and I will be charged for everything! I am still dealing with them to fix the situation but I wanted to warn everybody not to waste your time with these people!

Reviews.Title: “Beware! They will charge you for a canceled reservation!”
Reviews.Author: PandaLover63
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2-nights stay with them through AAA's Travel Center online on 4/28/06. I then canceled the reservation online on 5/3/06 and got a cancellation number thinking that everything has been taken care of. That was not so! On 5/26/06, a 2-nights' charge was charged to my credit card. I quickly call the motel to resolve this to no avail, but only encountered a rude person on the phone saying that they never charge anyone who books online and that they never received any cancellation, and ....they only charged me for a "No Show" 1 night. The clerk told me that he couldn't help and that I needed to contact AAA because it's not their fault. I contacted AAA on 5/30 and explained my dilemma. The agent from AAA's Utah center has placed 3 calls to their site general manager, Victor, to get this resolved and has not received any response. I've contacted Chase Bank to dispute the charges, as well as filed a complaint with the BBB of San Diego. Please spare yourself from the nonsense and hassle I'm having to go through by not booking this place. Stay away from it like the black plague!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: niniemilo
Reviews.Content: too small and terrible rooms. situated in a bad area

Reviews.Title: “great location, great deal.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed here before but have tried a few other local hotels. I was pleasantly surprised at what I got. The hotel is smaller but very close to Mission Bay and all it offers. My room was very clean and had quite a few things in it including a microwave and refrigerator. This was nice so we could keep our two year olds bottles etc. cold. They also had the Disney channel which I have never seen before at a hotel. The breakfast was much better than the usual "free" breakfasts that you get. And, our room was $15 cheaper than anything else I could find in the area for two beds. Also, the parking is close to your room and free. Most hotels charge and sometimes you have to park really far and drag your stuff. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: aprilstarr
Reviews.Content: rooms are little but vey clean,and have everything you need!!!you have a 7/11 next door and a good sushi joint too!!!and the price was not bad for Pacific beach..we are staying here the next time we are in San diego!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You might want to stay here to save money. The rooms in this old motel have been renovated. The location is not good requiring considerable driving to find a place to eat. The motel is hard to find. The street is noisy. The continental breakfast is a joke - probably the most meager I have ever seen. People on the front desk were not friendly and not helpful. Still, it offers value for the price, if you really want to save some money. It is certainly not as represented on their web page.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, noisy street, but central location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for a week and overall were split on our opinions of this place. Firstly, it had everything we wanted - microwave, fridge, dryer, wireless internet, continental bfast, central location. The fridge was empty and that was a good thing since we needed the space for milk, etc. I hate it when hotels stuff overpriced junk in their fridge. The wireless internet was flawless and speedy. Probably since the place is small and nobody is far from the main lobby. The location was central since you are 10 min from downtown, 5 min from seaworld, 10 min from La Jolla. In fact, there is a 7-11 next door, a Rubio's To Go across the st, and a McDonald's around the corner. However, the mornings were noisy since Mission Bay Drive gets busy at 7am. Parking was excellent since it was 20 feet from your room and free too. I hate walking 4 blocks to my car at most hotels and still have to pay $10/night. The room was also small - about 250 sq ft. My kids liked this since they are small and don't mind tight spaces. Bring your own crib/playpen if you have a baby. The bathtubs edges were too narrow so be careful if you are getting up from a tub bath. The breakfast was well stocked for the most part except for a day when they ran out of bananas. Staff was for the most part nice and professional except for one girl that was rude when we asked for extra shampoo (she was sick but I know that's no excuse). The website pictures look better than the real place and anybody is naive to think they didn't use a wide angle lens when taking those shots. The pool looks way smaller than the web pic but is heated. For about $100/night during August, I guess it's a value. Would we comeback? I would but my wife may not.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep and save money, close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Traye
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night out of our three in San Diego, and chose The Inn over the Catamaran Resort to save money for our stop in the Mission Beach/Pacific Beach area. I'm so glad we did, because The Inn is only a few minutes away from the beach and it saved us almost $100 with the cheaper room rate and free parking there. This hotel rating really deserves 2 1/2 to 3 1/2 stars, because it's almost above average for its motel class, but not quite, and the negatives might outweigh the positives for different types of guests. I give the owners credit because it seems as if they're trying to make it nice, to make the most out of an older building in an odd location--in the middle of a 7-11 and a car dealership, on a busy street--with pretty good amenities at a great price ($93 total, AREStravel.com). We got the one queen bed room, for just my boyfriend and I, and it was TINY, with a somewhat firm, but not hard, bed. Pros: Polite front desk staff, not-too-loud A/C unit, microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, new t.v. with cable, hair dryer, great shower water pressure. Cons: Did not see the "free wireless Internet access" anywhere (was that supposed to mean a computer?) aforementioned room and bed, clean but TINY pool and sunning area (keep in mind if bringing kids), thin ceilings and/or walls, and an abundance of housekeeping personnel. For such a small place, there were at least four ladies with carts spread out on the property, along with pool guys (and their children?). It was strange and made me feel slightly uneasy. The Inn was a great choice since we were just passing through on our way to a nicer hotel downtown, and it was comfortable overall, but it's not an extended vacation spot. That morning as I heard my neighbor's shower from our bathroom, and banging around upstairs similar to sounds heard in a first floor apartment, I was glad we were up and getting ready to check out rather than trying to sleep in and staying another night.

HotelInfo.Name: Red Roof Inn - Pacific Beach, San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 4545 Mission Bay Drive, San Diego, CA 92109
